intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: Azimah Tech ("we," "our," or "us") is committed to protecting your privacy in accordance with the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia's Personal Data Protection Law (PDPL) and its Implementing Regulations issued by the Saudi Data & Artificial Intelligence Authority (SDAIA). This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your personal data when you use our mobile applications (Customer App and Provider App) and website.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.item1: "Personal Data" means any data that can identify an individual directly or indirectly
definitions.item2: "Sensitive Data" includes data revealing ethnic origin, religious beliefs, health data, and financial information
definitions.item3: "Data Controller" means Azimah Tech, which determines the purposes and means of processing personal data
definitions.item4: "Data Subject" means you, the individual whose personal data is being processed

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.content: We process your personal data based on the following legal grounds under PDPL Article 5:
legalBasis.item1: Your explicit consent provided during registration
legalBasis.item2: Performance of a contract to which you are a party (service booking and delivery)
legalBasis.item3: Compliance with legal obligations under Saudi law
legalBasis.item4: Our legitimate interests in providing and improving our services

personal.title: Personal Information
personal.item1: Full name, email address, and phone number (for account creation and communication)
personal.item3: Delivery addresses and precise location data (for service delivery)
personal.item4: National ID or commercial registration (for provider verification only)

financial.title: Financial Information
financial.item1: Payment card details (processed securely by Paymob, not stored by us)

usage.title: Usage Information
usage.item1: Device information (device type, operating system, unique device identifiers)
usage.item2: App usage data, preferences, and interaction logs

purpose.title: Purpose of Data Processing
purpose.content: We collect and process your data for the following specific, clear, and explicit purposes:
purpose.item1: To create and manage your user account
purpose.item2: To facilitate bookings between customers and service providers
purpose.item3: To process payments and issue invoices
purpose.item4: To provide customer support and respond to inquiries
purpose.item5: To send service-related notifications (order updates, confirmations)
purpose.item6: To send promotional communications (only with your explicit consent)
purpose.item7: To improve our applications and develop new features
purpose.item8: To comply with legal and regulatory requirements

sharing.title: Data Sharing and Disclosure
sharing.content: We do not sell your personal data. We may share your data with:
sharing.item1: Service providers you book with (name, phone, delivery address - necessary for order fulfillment)
sharing.item2: Paymob (payment processor) - for secure transaction processing
sharing.item3: Supabase (cloud infrastructure) - for data storage and authentication
sharing.item4: Firebase/Google (analytics and notifications) - for app functionality
sharing.item5: Government authorities - when required by Saudi law or court order

crossBorder.title: Cross-Border Data Transfers
crossBorder.content: Your data may be transferred to and processed in countries outside Saudi Arabia where our service providers operate. We ensure appropriate safeguards are in place through:
crossBorder.item1: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) with international service providers
crossBorder.item2: Ensuring recipient countries provide adequate data protection
crossBorder.item3: Obtaining your explicit consent for such transfers during registration
crossBorder.note: You may withdraw consent for cross-border transfers at any time, which may affect service availability.

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.content: We retain your personal data only as long as necessary:
retention.item1: Account data: For the duration of your account plus 5 years for legal compliance
retention.item2: Transaction records: 10 years as required by Saudi commercial law
retention.item3: Marketing preferences: Until you withdraw consent
retention.deletion: Upon account deletion request, we will delete or anonymize your data within 30 days, except where retention is required by law.

security.title: Data Security
security.content: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data, including:
security.item1: SSL/TLS encryption for all data transmission
security.item2: Encrypted storage on secure Supabase servers

rights.title: Your Rights Under PDPL
rights.content: Under the Saudi Personal Data Protection Law, you have the following rights:
rights.item1: Right to be informed about how your data is collected and used
rights.item2: Right to access your personal data and obtain a copy
rights.item3: Right to correct inaccurate or incomplete data
rights.item4: Right to request deletion of your data (right to be forgotten)
rights.item5: Right to restrict processing of your data
rights.item6: Right to data portability (receive your data in a structured format)
rights.item7: Right to withdraw consent at any time
rights.item8: Right to object to processing based on legitimate interests
rights.exercise: To exercise any of these rights, contact us at azimahtec@gmail.com. We will respond within 30 days as required by PDPL.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: Our applications use the following third-party services, each with their own privacy policies:
thirdParty.supabase: Supabase - Database, authentication, and file storage (servers in Singapore)
thirdParty.firebase: Firebase/Google - Push notifications, analytics, crash reporting
thirdParty.google: Google Maps - Location services and mapping

children.title: Children's Privacy
children.content: Our services are not intended for individuals under 18 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal data from minors. If you believe a minor has provided us with personal data, please contact us immediately.

cookies.title: Cookies and Tracking
cookies.content: Our website uses essential cookies for functionality. Our mobile apps use device identifiers for analytics. You can manage cookie preferences in your browser settings.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy to reflect changes in our practices or legal requirements. We will notify you of material changes via the app or email at least 30 days before they take effect. Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance.

complaints.title: Complaints and Regulatory Authority
complaints.content: If you are not satisfied with our response to your data protection concerns, you have the right to lodge a complaint with:

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.content: For any questions about this Privacy Policy or to exercise your data rights, please contact us:

agreement.content: By accessing or using Azimah Tech applications and services, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service, which constitute a legally binding agreement under the laws of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. If you disagree with any part of these terms, you may not access our services.

eligibility.title: Eligibility
eligibility.content: You must be at least 18 years old and legally capable of entering into binding contracts under Saudi law to use our services. By using our applications, you represent and warrant that you meet these requirements.

accounts.title: User Accounts
accounts.item1: You must provide accurate, complete, and current information during registration
accounts.item2: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials
accounts.item3: You are responsible for all activities that occur under your account
accounts.item4: You must notify us immediately at azimahtec@gmail.com of any unauthorized account access
accounts.item5: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that violate these terms

services.title: Our Services
services.content: Azimah Tech provides a marketplace platform connecting customers with event service providers in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. We act as an intermediary and are not a party to the contracts between customers and providers.

customers.title: For Customers:
customers.item1: Browse and discover verified event service providers
customers.item2: Book services and make secure payments through Paymob
customers.item3: Track orders and communicate with providers
customers.item4: Leave honest reviews and ratings after service completion

providers.title: For Service Providers:
providers.item1: List and manage your services with accurate descriptions and pricing
providers.item2: Receive and fulfill customer orders in a timely manner
providers.item3: Maintain required licenses and permits for your business
providers.item4: Comply with all applicable Saudi laws and regulations

payments.title: Payments, Fees & VAT
payments.item1: All prices are displayed in Saudi Riyals (SAR) and include 15% Value Added Tax (VAT) as required by ZATCA
payments.item2: Payments are processed securely through Paymob, a licensed payment processor
payments.item3: Service providers set their own prices and are responsible for their accuracy
payments.item4: Azimah Tech charges a platform commission as disclosed to providers during registration
payments.item5: Electronic invoices will be issued for all transactions in compliance with ZATCA e-invoicing requirements

cancellations.title: Cancellations & Refunds
cancellations.content: Our cancellation and refund policy complies with Saudi consumer protection regulations:
cancellations.item1: Customers may cancel orders before provider acceptance for a full refund
cancellations.item2: Cancellations after acceptance are subject to the provider's cancellation policy (displayed before booking)
cancellations.item3: Refunds are processed within 14 business days to the original payment method
cancellations.item4: Disputes should be reported within 7 days of service delivery

provider.title: Provider Obligations
provider.content: Service providers using our platform agree to:
provider.item1: Maintain valid commercial registration (Sijil Tijari) and required licenses
provider.item2: Provide accurate service descriptions, photos, and pricing
provider.item3: Fulfill orders as described and on the agreed dates
provider.item4: Maintain appropriate insurance coverage for their services
provider.item5: Comply with Saudi health, safety, and quality standards
provider.item6: Register for VAT if annual revenues exceed the threshold

prohibited.title: Prohibited Activities
prohibited.item1: Use the service for any purpose that violates Saudi law or Islamic principles
prohibited.item2: Provide false, misleading, or fraudulent information
prohibited.item3: Offer or request services that are prohibited in Saudi Arabia
prohibited.item4: Interfere with the platform's security or proper functioning
prohibited.item5: Harass, abuse, or discriminate against other users
prohibited.item6: Circumvent the payment system or platform fees
prohibited.item7: Copy, modify, or distribute our intellectual property without permission

intellectual.title: Intellectual Property
intellectual.content: The Azimah Tech name, logo, app design, and all related trademarks, service marks, and content are the exclusive property of Azimah Tech. Users may not use, copy, or distribute these materials without prior written permission. Service providers retain ownership of their content but grant us a license to display it on the platform.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: To the maximum extent permitted by Saudi law: (a) Azimah Tech acts only as an intermediary platform and is not liable for the quality, safety, or legality of services provided by third-party providers; (b) We are not liable for any indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or punitive damages; (c) Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid for the specific service in question; (d) We do not guarantee uninterrupted or error-free service availability.

indemnification.title: Indemnification
indemnification.content: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Azimah Tech and its officers, directors, employees, and agents from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses (including legal fees) arising from: (a) your use of our services; (b) your violation of these Terms; (c) your violation of any third-party rights; (d) any content you submit to the platform.

disputes.title: Dispute Resolution
disputes.content: Any disputes arising from these Terms or your use of our services shall be resolved as follows:
disputes.item1: First, contact our support team to attempt informal resolution
disputes.item2: If unresolved within 30 days, disputes may be submitted to mediation
disputes.item3: Disputes that cannot be resolved through mediation shall be submitted to the competent courts in Jeddah, Saudi Arabia

governing.title: Governing Law
governing.content: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, including but not limited to: the E-Commerce Law, Consumer Protection Law, Personal Data Protection Law, and Anti-Commercial Fraud Law. The competent courts in Jeddah shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any disputes.

termination.title: Termination
termination.content: We may terminate or suspend your account and access to our services: (a) immediately for violation of these Terms; (b) immediately for fraudulent or illegal activity; (c) with 30 days notice for any other reason. Upon termination, your right to use the services ceases immediately, but provisions regarding intellectual property, limitation of liability, and governing law survive.

force.title: Force Majeure
force.content: Neither party shall be liable for delays or failures in performance resulting from circumstances beyond their reasonable control, including natural disasters, war, terrorism, government actions, or pandemic-related restrictions.

changes.content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. We will notify users of material changes via the app or email at least 30 days before they take effect.
